action.action-desc: Mr. McDermott introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the income exclusion for discharge of qualified principal residence indebtedness, to provide exclusions from income for certain payments under the National Mortgage Settlement, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Homeowner Tax Fairness Act
.

section.header: Extension of income exclusion for discharge of qualified principal residence indebtedness

subsection.text: Subparagraph (E) of section 108(a)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking January 1, 2014 and inserting January 1, 2017.

Subparagraph (E) of section 108(a)(1) of such Code, as amended by subsection (a), is amended by inserting before the period the following: , or which is discharged after such date pursuant to an agreement entered into before such date under the programs created pursuant to, or using funds authorized by the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 .

paragraph.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to discharges in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.
The amendment made by subsection (b) shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Extension of deduction for mortgage insurance premiums

subsection.text: Subclause (I) of section 163(h)(3)(E)(iv) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking December 31, 2013 and inserting December 31, 2015.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to amounts paid or accrued after December 31, 2013.

section.header: Exclusions relating to National Mortgage Settlement payments

subsection.text: Part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (relating to items specifically excluded from gross income) is amended by inserting before section 140 the following new section:
In the case of an individual, gross income shall not include any National Mortgage Settlement amount.
For purposes of subsection (a), the term National Mortgage Settlement amount means, with respect to any amount received under the National Mortgage Settlement, an amount which is—

paragraph.text: a payment from the Borrower Payment Fund under the National Mortgage Settlement to a borrower whose qualified principal residence was sold or taken in foreclosure after December 31, 2007, and before January 1, 2014, or

a payment received as a result of a foreclosure or excess charge of interest that the United States Department of Justice has determined was not in compliance with the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act.

subsection.header: Disregard of refund of excess mortgage interest and related damages
subsection.text: In the case of an individual, the amount of interest refunded and damages paid under the National Mortgage Settlement for excess charges of mortgage interest described in subsection (b)(3)—

paragraph.text: shall be disregarded for purposes of this chapter, and
no adjustment of the deduction allowable under section 163(h) shall be made as a result of such refund.

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the term National Mortgage Settlement means any consent agreement entered into in settlement of the action entitled The United States of America, et al. against Bank of America Corporation, et al., filed in the United States District Court for the District of Columbia on March 12, 2012 (case numbered 1:12–cv–00361–RMC).
The table of sections for such part III is amended by inserting before the item relating to section 140 the following new item:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts paid on or after February 9, 2012, in taxable years ending after such date.

section.header: Denial of business deduction for National Mortgage Settlement payments

subsection.text: Section 162 of such Code is amended by redesignating subsection (q) as subsection (r) and by inserting after subsection (p) the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: No deduction shall be allowed under this chapter for any National Mortgage Settlement amount that was paid in exchange for a full release of the United States potential civil claims under the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act.
The term National Mortgage Settlement amount has the meaning given such term by section 139F.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts paid in taxable years ending after February 1, 2014.
